meanings.definition: Make or cause to make a ringing metallic sound.
meanings.sent1: The keys jangles as I walk.
meanings.sent2: The bells jangles softly in the wind.
meanings.sent3: The wind chime jangles merrily in the breeze.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter jangles like a set of wind chimes.
meanings.sent5: The tambourine jangles with each shake.

meanings.sent1: I heard the jangles of the tambourine.
meanings.sent2: The jangles of the keys echoed in the hallway.
meanings.sent3: The jangles of the bracelets filled the room with music.
meanings.sent4: The jangles of the coins in his pocket were a constant jingle.
meanings.sent5: The jangles of the wind chimes created a soothing melody.

meanings.sent1: The jangles of the out-of-tune piano were unbearable.
meanings.sent2: The jangles of the broken alarm clock woke me up.
meanings.sent3: The jangles of the off-key singing made everyone cringe.
meanings.sent4: The jangles of the car engine signaled trouble ahead.
meanings.sent5: The jangles of the pots and pans clashing together filled the kitchen.
